Form.Name: black rhinoceros
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a black rhinoceros echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This beast with armored skin features two keratin-sheathed horns sprouting from a core of bone in the front of the face. The front horn is longer than the second, ready to impale his next victim.

Form.Name: dire wolf
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a dire wolf echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This immensely large gray wolf seems as big as a horse. It has fiery eyes, a thick coat of fur, and spikes crowning the top of its spine.

Form.Name: golden jaguar
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a golden jaguar echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The jaguar is a compact and well-muscled animal, ready to pounce.

Form.Name: grizzled ram
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a grizzled ram echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The Ram looks virile and strong, and snorts at you brazenly.

Form.Name: grizzly bear
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a grizzly bear echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The grizzly bear is a massive animal with humped shoulders and an elevated forehead that contributes to a somewhat concave profile.

Form.Name: lion
Form.LongDescription: A massive, yellow maned lion whips around and regards you dispassionately before turning away.
Form.Yell: The loud roar of a lion echoes nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A large tawny-colored cat stares you down.

Form.Name: massive alligator
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a massive alligator echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This 800 pound alligator looks hungry and ready to use its powerful tail to make a point. A broad U-shaped snout has a distinct overbite, flesh ripping teeth exposed for all to see.

Form.Name: silverback gorilla
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a silverback gorilla echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Hands Fingers Ear Eye
Form.Description: A six foot gorilla with a silverback growls at you.

Form.Name: tiger
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a tiger echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A distinctive orange-and-black-striped cat sits here licking blood off its powerful paws.

Form.Name: wolverine
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a wolverine echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A stocky and muscular animal is here, its small eyes and short rounded ears more closely resemble a bear than a wolverine A distinct yet horid odor seems to linger behind it.

Form.Name: arctic fox
Form.Yell: The loud cry of an arctic fox echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A fox looks well adapted to living in cold environments, its thick, warm fur serving a dual purpose as camouflage. It has a large and very fluffy tail.

Form.Name: boar
Form.Yell: The loud snort of a boar echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The wild boar is a cumbersome, massively constructed suid with quick and comparatively skinny legs. The trunk is brief and sturdy, whereas the hindquarters are underdeveloped. The area behind the shoulder blades rises right into a hump and the neck is brief and thick to the purpose of being practically motionless. The animals head is massive, taking as much as one- third of the bodys total size.

Form.Name: copperhead
Form.Yell: The loud hiss of a striped copperhead echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A snake with copper-collered head and reddish-brown hourglass pattern on its body quickly vibrates its tail in warning. Almost four feet long, it begins to slither, a sharp hiss escaping its mouth.

Form.Name: lynx
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a lynx echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: You see a "bobcat" with small tufts of hair jutting from the tips of their ears. This medium sized cat is covered with a thick fur coat, and its harry paws resemble snowshoes, perfect for navigating heavy winter snows.

Form.Name: snow badger
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a snow badger echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A badger has a stout body and short legs. The fur on its legs and across its eyes is black, while the rest of its head and underbelly is white.

Form.Name: striped badger
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a striped badger echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A badger has a black face with distinctive white markings, its grey body has a light-coloured stripe from head to tail, its dark legs with light-coloured underbelly. A badger is three feet long, including tail.

Form.Name: wary ocelot
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a wary ocelot echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A medium-sized spotted wild cat is here, its spots running along its shoulders and back in lines the length of its body. The back of its ears are black with a white spot in the center.

Form.Name: wolf
Form.Yell: The loud howl of an old wolf echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This large gray wolf seems not quite as big as a horse. It has fiery eyes, a thick coat of fur, and spikes crowning the top of its spine.

Form.Name: black bear
Form.Yell: The loud roar of a black bear echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The black bear is a massive animal with humped shoulders and an elevated forehead that contributes to a somewhat concave profile.

Form.Name: black panther
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a black panther echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye

Form.Name: bullfrog
Form.Yell: The loud call of a bullfrog echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This green and brown bullfrog has large bulging eyes at the top of its skull, giving it a wide frame of vision. Its throat is moving very quickly even when resting. Toughing its wet skin with visible blood vessels could be bad.

Form.Name: great moose
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a great moose echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This bull moose has dark brown colored fur, which is thick enough to help insulate during the frigid, snowy winters. Giant antlers adorn his head, a long, hair-covered waddle growing from his neck and a very large, bulbous nose with long nostrils.

Form.Name: jackal
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a jackal echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A large jackal with tan fur looks hungry. Its long legs look powerful, and its pointed snout most likely gives it a great sense of smell.

Form.Name: whip scorpion
Form.Yell: The loud screech of a whip scorpion echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye Pincers
Form.Description: This scorpion has a long multi-articulated flagellum at the end of its body, as well as orifices of its anal glands on both sides epelling a vinegar-like odor.

Form.Name: zebra
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a zebra echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye

Form.Name: feral pig
Form.LongDescription: A feral pig stands here looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a feral pig echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The wild pig is a cumbersome, massively constructed suid with quick and comparatively skinny legs. The trunk is brief and sturdy, whereas the hindquarters are underdeveloped. The area behind the shoulder blades rise into a hump, and the neck is brief and thick to the purpose of being practically motionless. The animals head is massive, taking as much as one- third of the bodys total size.

Form.Name: ferret
Form.LongDescription: A ferret stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a ferret echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This weasel looking creature has a long body with short legs, small ears and a small head. A cream colored face is surrounded by brown coat, with a darker patch of fur around its eyes. You notice it's short but very sharp looking teeth, and decide this creature wont make a decent pet after all.

Form.Name: majestic elk
Form.LongDescription: A majestic elk stands here looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a majestic elk echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This bull elk has light brown colored fur, which is thick insulation against the frigid, snowy winters. Modest antlers adorn his head, a long, hair-covered waddle growing from his neck and a very large nose with long nostrils.

Form.Name: mountain goat
Form.LongDescription: A mountain goat stands here looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a mountain goat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A shaggy, large hoofed goat is here, scratching itself with its long black horns. Its white coat of fur has a double layer of hair, giving it superior resistance to rain and cold. You can tell by its double hooved feet and its dewclaws that climbing on wet, steep hills would present very little challenge.

Form.Name: ornery mule
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an ornery mule echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: Just like you might expect, this hybrid looks like a mixture between a donkey and a horse. Its body is slightly stouter than an average horse, but leaner than a donkey. Its ears are also slightly longer than those of a horse, but shorter than those of a donkey.

Form.Name: soldier ant
Form.LongDescription: A giant soldier ant stands here.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a soldier ant echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Guts Feet Mandible Eye
Form.Description: A giant soldier ant is here, grown beyond all possibly believability. A giant mandable is comparable to the most dangerous predatory weapon you have ever seen. A steady stream of saliva drips from its mandable, hissing as it hits the ground.

Form.Name: angry crocodile
Form.Yell: The loud cry of an angry crocodile echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This 800 pound crocodile looks hungry and ready to use its powerful tail to defend itself. You see large tooth projects from either side of its narrow narrow V-shaped snout even when closed.

Form.Name: armadillo
Form.LongDescription: A funny looking armadillo stands here looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an armadillo echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The armadillo is twice as large as a house cat, three feet long and about 120 pounds. Its extremely thick, scally leather skin looks adapted to protecting its outer shelled extremely well.

Form.Name: diamondback rattlesnake
Form.Yell: The loud hiss of a diamondback rattlesnake echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Fangs Heart Brains Guts Eye
Form.Description: An eight foot rattlesnake is here, diamond shaped patterns across its back. It gives a shake of its hollow rattle, warning to keep your distance.

Form.Name: komodo dragon
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a komodo dragon echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This imposing reptile sports a venom-laden mouth, a set of 60 sharp teeth, and a keen sense of smell. Weighing 150 pounds and 10 feet long, it appears to have a tenacious hunting vigor.

Form.Name: lemur
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a lemur echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Hands Fingers Ear Eye

Form.Name: mongoose
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a mongoose echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This small, weasel-like creature has a pointed snout and long body, and moves faster than anything else seen. Oddly, you notice webbing on its feet, indicating no fear of water, yet also clawed for tree climbing.

Form.Name: pachyderm
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a pachyderm echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A powerful behemoth with extremely thick skin sways its long trunk in your direction. Standing 9 feet tall and weighing over a ton, you should avoid its trunk and large hooves if at all possible.

Form.Name: porcupine
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a porcupine echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This giant rodent is completely covered in sharp defensive spines. This 2 foot 60 pound porcupine is dark colored, with lighter colored spine tips.

Form.Name: bobcat
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a muscular bobcat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: You see a "bobcat" with small tufts of hair jutting from the tips of its ears. This medium sized cat is covered with a thick fur coat, and its harry paws resemble snowshoes, perfect for navigating heavy winter snows.

Form.Name: hare
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a hare echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye

Form.Name: polar bear
Form.Yell: The loud roar of a polar bear echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A 1600 pound polar bear is here, stocky, with a long neck and relatively small head. Its ears are short and rounded, its tail short and pointed. As it moves you notice uneven thick skin on the soles of his feet for sure-footedness. Strong sharp claws not only aid in extra traction, but look dangerous to face.

Form.Name: sand lizard
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a sand lizard echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A green lizard with dark bands running along its body is here, its tail making up half of its total length, which appears to aid in balance and high- speed running. You notice small pads on its feet which probably aid its ability to grip sand and still run quickly.

Form.Name: snow leopard
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a snow leopard echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye

Form.Name: tortoise
Form.LongDescription: A tortoise stands here looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an tortoise echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A giant tortoise is here, covered in a brown-green hard shell for protection. Its feet have large tough claws for digging, rather than webbing like its cousin the turtle. This creature appears to be slow moving due to the shortness of its legs, yet speed isnt important when it dig deep into the ground, then retract its entire body into its own personal home.

Form.Name: beetle
Form.LongDescription: A stag beetle stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a stag beetle echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A giant beetle is here, its bright oval shaped body has a relatively smooth surface. Its bronze metalic body is partially covered by its two pair of wings. Short antennae help guide it, and both the forelegs and hindlegs are fringed with hairs that are used as paddles. A pair of oversized mandibles in front are used to grab or pinch.

Form.Name: brown bear
Form.LongDescription: A brown bear stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud roar of a brown bear echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A shaggy brown bear is here, licking its huge paw. Protruding from its paws are huge claws, nearly four inches long. A single strike could mangle its prey.

Form.Name: clouded leopard
Form.LongDescription: A cloudy leopard paces here, while looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a clouded leopard echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A clouded leopard has dexterous paws with specialized footpads for gripping branches. Specialized ankebones allow varied position for climbing, even climbing headfirst down trees. The canine teeth are longer in proportion to the skull size than in any other wild cat you have seen.

Form.Name: opossum
Form.LongDescription: An opossum stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an opossum echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This marsupials has an elongated snout, and a large sagittal crest – a bone making its forehead look taller. It has scaly feet, and a scaly prehensile tail. A prehensile tail can be wrapped around branches to stabilize the animal while climbing.

Form.Name: tuara lizard
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a tuara lizard echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: An ancient looking lizard-like reptile is gray to greenish-gray in color and covered with scales. It has large, dark eyes, short limbs, and a long tail. There is a row of white spines along its back. You count five claws on each limb and three rows of sharp teeth in its mouth. A third eye on the top of its head indicates it is not fully mature yet, since in mature tuara it becomes covered in scales.

Form.Name: wombat
Form.LongDescription: An ugly wombat stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an ugly wombat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye

Form.Name: horned lizard
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an horned lizard echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye Tail
Form.Description: A horned lizard has spikes on its head and body. It has a flattened, angular appearance with a short, wide body and short legs. Its skin is gray, with patterns of spots that help it blend in with their surroundings. Its eyes are large and set on the top of its head, giving it a 360-degree view of its surroundings. The horns on its head are all sharp and tough, used for defense against predators. It has additional spikes on its backs and sides, further enhancing its ability to defend itself.

Form.Name: marmot
Form.LongDescription: A marmot stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a marmot echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This marmot looks like a miniature bear. It has a chubby, stocky appearance with short legs and a short, furry tail. Its fur is gray with a lighter underbelly. You see it has small ears and a rounded face but with large, curious eyes. You notice its strong, sharp claws that they probably use for digging burrows and climbing trees.

Form.Name: spiny hedgehog
Form.LongDescription: A spiny hedgehog stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a tiny hedgehog echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The dorsal surface and sides of this hedgehog are covered in pale spines that have a wide brown band and a white tip. The spines are relatively long, and when curled into a prickly ball this hedgehog can be quite defensive.

Form.Name: swamp rat
Form.LongDescription: A swamp rat stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a swamp rat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A huge swamp rat is not a rat, it looks like a beaver but is not a beaver, and yet it could be mistaken for a muskrat too. It has a hairless tail, but appears to have 3 sets of fur. Guard hairs on the outer coat are 3 inches thick, then coarse, darkish midlayer fur with soft a softer dense grey under- fur. You notice several teeth, including four large yellow incisors.

Form.Name: warthog
Form.LongDescription: A funny looking tusked warthog stands here looking around.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an warthog echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A stoutly build, dark skinned warthog is here, its large head equipped with defensive tusks. The tusks are elongated upper teeth, and are similar to an elephants tusks. A short mane runs down the neck and the middle of its back, a tuft of hair adorns the tip of its tail.

Form.Name: weasel
Form.LongDescription: A weasel stands here looking around inquisitively.
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a weasel echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This weasel has a slim, elongated body with a small, flattish, triangular head. It has small, rounded ears but large eyes and a pointy snout with long whiskers. Its back is brown, but has a yellow chin and belly.

Form.Name: cavefisher
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a cavefisher echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A cave fisher is 7 long and has a hard, chitinous shell arranged in overlapping plates for an exoskeleton. It had eight legs and two forelimbs that ends in large pincers. A sightless creature used to underground living that uses multiple auditory sensor organs to detect prey.

Form.Name: cheetah
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a cheetah echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This cheetah is covered almost entirely with small black spots on a background of pale yellow and has a white underbelly. Its face is distinguished by prominent black lines that curve from the inner corner of each eye to the outer corners of the mouth, like a well-worn trail of inky tears. A muscled, long and slender four foot body, and a three foot tail ending in a white tuft, combined with its elongated spine, this cat is adapted to high speed sprints.

Form.Name: cobra
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a cobra echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Fangs Heart Brains Guts Eye
Form.Description: This thick-bodied 10 feet long snake with a flattened hood on its neck rears upright at your approach. Its head is bright yellow and black, and the rest of its body is a mottled combination of the two.

Form.Name: fox
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a fox echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A fox has a long body and tail, and is covered in red fur. It has black fur on its feet, the tips of their ears, and a distinctive white tuft at the end of its tail. You notice that this fox has rather elongated muzzle, and long, sharp canine like teeth.

Form.Name: howler monkey
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a howler monkey echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Hands Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: The howler monkey exhibits a noticeably big neck and lower jaw with huge vocal cords. This primate is also the largest monkey you have ever seen. Another characteristic feature you notice is its prehensile tail, acting as a 'fifth limb', allowing it to grip and hang from tree branches.

Form.Name: orangutan
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a orangutan echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Hands Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A very large, red-orange colored primate is here, an intellegent look in its eyes. Its lengthy armspan is over 6 feet across, and it stands almost 5 feet tall. Its long, muscular arms and hook-like hands are perfectly adapted for gripping branches. Its feet has apposable big toes just like its hands and thumbs, giving it essentially 4 hands to work with.

Form.Name: striped hyena
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a striped hyena echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This female dominant dog-like predator is actually more closely related to the cat. It has a short torso, and low hindquarters giving its back a hunched appearance. It has long forelegs and a thick neck, and from its head to its tail, the back slope noticeably downward. This Hyena is brown in color, with dark stripes and some spots.

Form.Name: trapdoor spider
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a trapdoor spider echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Eye Mandible
Form.Description: This giant spider has 8 eyes arranged in two pairs of four, and is a brownish color with black patterns. It has long blunt spinnerets on its legs, aiding it to better "grab" its prey.

Form.Name: wildcat
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a wildcat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This cat similar to the domestic cat but has longer legs, a larger, flatter head, and a full, relatively short tail ending in a rounded tip. Its coat is yellowish gray with dark stripes and bands in the striped tabby pattern; the tail is black-ringed.

Form.Name: baboon
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a baboon echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Hands Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This baboon is large and powerfully built. It has large head with a long, dog-like muzzle and cheek-pouches for storing food. A heavy brow ridge protects its eyes. You notice two rows of very sharp teeth.

Form.Name: bombardier beetle
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a bombardier beetle echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A giant ground beetle is here, preparing to defend itself. It has reddish head and limbs, and blue wing coverings.

Form.Name: cat
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a cat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This cats eyes are red, swollen and inflamed. Excessive saliva continues to drip from its mouth, a never ending drool. Every so often a strange and disconcerting yowl escapes its mouth.

Form.Name: giant mantis
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a giant mantis echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A giant mantis is several feet tall, with large, sharp, raptorial arms and an elongated body that is covered in a hard exoskeleton. The size and apparent strength of those arms indicate a possible powerful grip to hold onto its prey.

Form.Name: long legged spider
Form.LongDescription: A hairy long legged spider stands here.
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a hairy long legged spider echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Mandible
Form.Description: A giant spider has a pear-shaped body and its long, thin legs are covered in fine hairs which could be for movement and for sensing their environment. It has brightly colored legs, giving it a quick and agile look. Its legs appearance strong enough to hunt and capture its prey.

Form.Name: ostrich
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a ostrich echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A giant ostrich is an impressive and formidable sight to behold. This is abbrev massive bird, 9 feet tall and over 300 pounds. Its long, powerful legs and neck probably enable it to run forever without tiring. You also notice sharp claws it can use for protection and foraging for food. Feathers are soft and fluffy, black and white in color, with a distinctive bald head with bright red skin. Its large eyes are positioned on the sides of its head, giving it a 360-degree view of its surroundings

Form.Name: racoon
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a racoon echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Hands Ear Eye
Form.Description: This raccoon is a medium-sized mammal with distinctive black mask-like markings on its face. Its front paws are extremely agile and have long fingers with highly sensitive pads, indicating an extreme sence of touch, enabling it to detect the slightest movement or vibration. Its front paws resemble hands, enableing it to manipulate objects and search for food.

Form.Name: spider monkey
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a spider monkey echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Hands Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A monkey with long, slender arms and legs is here, its prehensile tail helps it swing and climb through the trees.

Form.Name: stink badger
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a stink badger echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Hands Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: You notice a powerful smell coming from this badger, which really isnt a badger at all. It looks more like a weasel or ferret, except for the smell, which from the whiff you catch, is definately defensive in nature.

Form.Name: swift gazelle
Form.LongDescription: A swift looking gazelle stands here.
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a swift looking gazelle echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This gazelle has long, slender legs and a sleek body that allow it to reach speeds of up to 60 miles per hour.

Form.Name: camel
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a two-humped camel echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A two-humped camel is 7 feet tall and weighs around 1200 pounds. Between its long legs, large humps, and thick fur, you imagine it could stay warm in the coldest environments.

Form.Name: giant leech
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a giant leech echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A long, slimy leech is here with multiple rows of sharp teeth. A sucker on both ends of its body allow it to securly attach to their prey to feed for extended periods of time.

Form.Name: giant toad
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a giant toad echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A slow-moving giant toad with a wide body, bumpy skin, and short, stocky legs is here. Its skin is covered in warts and bumps, helping it to blend in with its surroundings and provides some protection from predators.

Form.Name: gibbon
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a gibbon echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Hands Ear Eye
Form.Description: This gibbon has long arms, relative to its body size, that it uses to swing through the trees and make precise movements. Its skeletal structure is optimized for mobility and strength, allowing it to move with grace and speed. It looks highly agile and acrobatic, giving it an advantage when hunting prey.

Form.Name: honey badger
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a honey badger echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A honey badgers fur is thick and dense, ranging in color from gray to almost black. The fur looks like it would help to protect the honey badger from bites and stings, and also provides insulation, keeping it warm in colder climates. It has long, sharp claws on its front paws that it uses for digging and for gripping onto its prey. It also has strong, sharp teeth that it uses for biting and tearing apart its food.

Form.Name: mustang
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a mustang echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This mustang is a large sized horse, standing between 6 feet tall at the shoulder. It has a muscular and compact build, with a sturdy neck, deep chest, and well-muscled hindquarters. Its color is chestnut with some white markings on its face and legs legs. Unkept mane and tail are thick, giving it a wild appearance. It has a distinctive and intelligent look in its eyes, large and expressive. Besides its rugged appearance, it has a natural scruffiness that is characteristic of horses that live in the wild.

Form.Name: scorpion
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a scorpion echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Pincers Eye
Form.Description: A giant scorpion is here, its double pincers ready to hold its prey. Besides its pincers, it features a dangerous looking stinger, dripping with what appears to be some kind of poisonous venom.

Form.Name: skunk
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a skunk echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This skunk has thick, soft fur that is black with white markings on the face, back, and tail. The white markings on the skunks fur is a single white stripe down the back. The skunks fur looks deep and thinck, providing insulation and helps to protect it from the elements. It is also an important factor in their camouflage, as the black and white coloring helps the skunk blend in with its surroundings and avoid detection by predators.

Form.Name: anteater
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of an anteater echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A large anteater is here, sporting its 4 inch long claws as formidable weapons. Its fur covers the entire body and is coarse and brown in color. Its long snout opens to reveal an even longer tongue, about 2 feet in length.

Form.Name: chimpanzee
Form.Yell: The loud call of a chimpanzee echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Hands Ear Eye
Form.Description: This primate has dense, shaggy fur that is black in color. The fur on their faces, ears, and hands are a lighter pale grey. This chimps anatomy is designed for climbing, swinging, and grasping, making it well-adapted to life in the trees. Powerful arms, legs, and fingers, allow it to easily move through the canopy and hold onto branches and other objects. You can tell it is capable of incredible feats of strength, such as lifting objects several times its own weight. This strength, combined with its agility and dexterity, makes it an excellent climber and enables it to perform a wide range of movements with ease and precision.

Form.Name: coyote
Form.Yell: The loud howling of a coyote echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This coyote has a thick and dense coat of fur that helps to insulate from the cold and protect them from physical injuries. Its fur is reddish-brown, with a lighter underbelly and black fur on the tips of its tails and legs. You notice very sharp looking claws extending from each paw, as well as sharp teeth set in a very strong looking jaw.

Form.Name: deer
Form.Yell: The loud call of a deer echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: This deer has a long and slender neck, large eyes, and a small tail. Its legs are long and end in cloven hooves, and its ten-point antlers look sharp and dangerous. Its fur is a brownish-red, with a white underbelly and some spots on its body. A sleek form and strong legs are clues this creature may be a very fast runner.

Form.Name: giant squirrel
Form.Yell: The loud squeal of a giant squirrel echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: With its striking size, bushy tail, and vivid coloration, this squirrel is a standout among its smaller relatives. Its strong hind legs combined with a tail used for balance and stability enable this creature to huge leaps from tree to tree.

Form.Name: mastiff
Form.Yell: The loud barking of a mastiff echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A 200 pound mastiff has a massive head, broad chest, and sturdy legs, giving it a commanding presence. Apricot in color, this mastiff also has a black mask on its coat. Its massive strong jaw and sharp teeth are nothing to take for granted.

Form.Name: red wolf
Form.Yell: The loud howl of a red wolf echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Arms Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Ear Eye
Form.Description: A wolf with reddish-brown fur and long legs is here. It has a thick, dense fur that provides insulation against the elements, helping it to maintain its body heat. The fur is composed of a dense underlayer and a longer outer layer, which provides additional protection against the wind and rain. The fur also helps to protect the red wolfs skin from injuries that can occur while hunting in dense brush or rocky terrain.

Form.Name: falcon
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a falcon echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
Form.Description: A majestic bird of prey is here with distinctive appearance. It is sleek looking with an aerodynamic body covered in dark feathers, but with a lighter chest and belly. This falcon's beak is hooked, and it's large, piercing eyes can see small details at a great distance. You notice powerful wings with long, pointed primary feathers, enabling them to fly at incredibly high speeds.

Form.Name: giant wasp
Form.Yell: The loud buzz of a giant wasp echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
Form.Description: A giant wasp has a robust and elongated body, featuring bright colors like yellow, black, orange, and it's hairless exoskeleton gives it a shiny and smooth appearance. This wasp has large, multifaceted eyes and powerful, sharp mandibles. Strong wings that allow it to fly with speed and agility.

Form.Name: golden eagle
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a golden eagle echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
Form.Description: An eagle has a dark brown body with golden-brown feathers on its head and nape. Its large size, with a wingspan of up to 7 feet, and sharp, hooked beak and talons make it an imposing hunter. Golden eagles are known for their keen eyesight, which allows them to spot prey from high in the sky,

Form.Name: great horned owl
Form.LongDescription: A great horned owl stands here.
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a great horned owl echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
Form.Description: A majestic bird of prey with a distinct appearance is here. It has large, piercing yellow eyes, framed by prominent feathered "horns" on its head, giving it a fierce and intimidating look. Its body is robust and covered in mottled brown and white feathers, providing excellent camouflage against tree bark or foliage. With a wingspan of up to five feet, it can fly silently through the night sky, aided by its specialized feathers that muffle sound.

Form.Name: hummingbird
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a hummingbird echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings
Form.Description: A small, colorful hummingbird is here, hovering in mid-air. It has a have a compact body, short neck, and a long, thin beak that is perfectly adapted for sipping nectar from flowers. It's wings are long and narrow, allowing them to flap incredibly fast, up to 80 times per second, which creates a humming sound that gives them their name. This hummingbird displays it's agile and acrobatic flying skills, darting and dive in any direction with ease.

Form.Name: vampire bat
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a vampire bat echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
Form.Description: A large bat has short, brown fur and large, pointed ears. Its most distinctive feature is its sharp, pointy teeth, which it uses to bite into the skin of its prey. It has small, beady eyes adapted to a nocturnal lifestyle. It's sharp teeth look specifically adapted for puncturing the skin of their prey and are capable of making multiple small incisions to feed from.

Form.Name: vulture
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a vulture echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
Form.Description: A large bird of prey is here, it's bald head has only a few small feathers or bristles around the base of it's neck. A pointed and hooked beak is surrounded by a ring of sharp bony protrusions, most likely to help grip and tear apart it's prey. Its body is covered in dark feathers, and it has broad wings and a short, strong tail.

Form.Name: boulder hawk
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a boulder hawk echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws

Form.Name: burrowing owl
Form.Yell: The loud cry of a burrowing owl echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws

Form.Yell: The loud cry of a crag soarer echos nearby.
Form.Parts: Head Legs Heart Brains Guts Feet Eye Wings Claws
